mission.title: Our Mission
mission.text: Founded in Vancouver in 2017, DSDC is a global online debate coaching institution dedicated to breaking down barriers by delivering world-class coaching at an affordable cost. We empower students to develop confidence, critical thinking, and communication skills that last a lifetime.

items.q: What ages and grades do you teach?
items.a: We offer classes for students in Grades 4 through 12, with programs tailored to each age group — Novice (Grades 4–6), Junior (Grades 7–9), Senior (Grades 10–12), and Advanced Competitive (Grades 10–12).

All classes are held live online via Zoom. Group classes are 2 hours per session, with small groups of 8–12 students to ensure personalized attention. Private coaching is customizable in length with a 1-hour minimum. Students receive written feedback from their coach every class.

We publish our rates openly: Novice & Intermediate Debate and Public Speaking are $390 CAD per 13-week term plus applicable taxes, World Scholar's Cup is $520 CAD per term plus applicable taxes, and Advanced Debate is $650 CAD per term plus applicable taxes. Private coaching (1-on-1, 2-on-1, or 3-on-1) is priced separately based on coach and group size. See our Pricing page for full details.

items.q: Does my child need prior debate experience?
items.a: Not at all! Our Novice and Public Speaking classes are designed for complete beginners. Many of our most successful students started with zero experience. We'll recommend the right level during your free consultation.

items.q: What does a typical class look like?
items.a: Classes begin with a brief warm-up or lesson on a current topic, followed by structured practice (speeches or debates), and conclude with personalized feedback from the coach. Students also receive homework to continue developing their skills.

items.q: Can my child try a class before committing?
items.a: Yes! We encourage families to book a free consultation first. We can often arrange a trial session so your child can experience the class environment before enrolling.

items.q: What is the World Scholar's Cup?
items.a: The World Scholar's Cup (WSC) is a prestigious international academic competition. DSDC has maintained a 100% qualification rate since 2020 — every team we've coached has advanced from regionals to global rounds, with many qualifying for the Tournament of Champions at Yale University.

items.q: How do I register or get started?
items.a: The easiest way to start is to book a free 15-minute consultation. We'll discuss your child's interests, recommend the right class, and walk you through enrollment — no commitment required.

teamPage.title: Our Team
teamPage.subtitle: Meet the decorated coaches behind our students' success
teamPage.founderBio: Rebecca founded DSDC at age 15 after parents began approaching her with coaching inquiries. With nearly a decade of experience and over 1,000 students coached, she is a Grand Finalist at Canadian Nationals and a Quarterfinalist at US Nationals. Currently studying Law at the University of Sydney on a $40,000 scholarship, Rebecca is passionate about making debate accessible to all.
founderKeyAchievements: Top Speaker - UBC High School Debate

coaches.name: Archie Wolifson
coaches.title: Senior Debate Coach
coaches.bio: A scholarship student at the University of Sydney, Archie is the 3rd Ranked Reply Speaker in Australia and Asia and a Quarterfinalist at the 2025 World University Debating Championships. His remarkable record as a Grand Finalist at the 2023 BP World Championships makes him one of the best debaters in the world.

coaches.name: Timothy Hanna
coaches.title: Senior Debate Coach
coaches.bio: Pursuing Law and Arts at the University of Sydney, Tim is a 14-time intervarsity grand finalist and 4-time champion. Under his guidance, students have advanced to the Semi-Finals of the Oxford Schools Championships and the Octo-Finals of the International Debating Championship.

coaches.name: Gabrielle Wong
coaches.title: Senior Debate & Public Speaking Coach
coaches.bio: Gabrielle represented Canada on the 2019–2020 national debate team and currently serves as President of the Debate and Speech Association of British Columbia. A Grand Champion at BP BC Provincials and Grand Finalist at Canadian Nationals, she studies at Simon Fraser University.

coaches.name: Rose Oh
coaches.title: Senior Debate Coach
coaches.bio: A pre-med student at Queen's University with over five years of coaching experience, Rose made history as the first Canadian to receive a Gold Bid at the US Tournament of Champions. Originally from South Korea, she brings a unique international perspective to her coaching.

coaches.name: Serina Guo
coaches.title: Senior Debate & WSC Coach
coaches.bio: Pursuing Law and Economics at the University of Sydney, Serina competed at the WSC Tournament of Champions at Yale and is a Quarterfinalist at the Australasian Women and Gender Minorities Championships. She has four years of coaching experience and has led teams to finals at major Sydney tournaments.

coaches.name: Finn Liu
coaches.title: Senior Debate Coach
coaches.bio: With five years of competitive experience in CNDF and British Parliamentary debate, Finn has earned awards at provincial and national tournaments. He is passionate about helping students develop the confidence to express their opinions analytically and persuasively.

coaches.name: Emily Cui
coaches.title: Debate & WSC Coach
coaches.bio: A Duke University student entering her 5th year coaching at DSDC, Emily has found success at tournaments both nationally and internationally, including winning the Canada Cup and reaching the Octo-Finals at the Stanford Invitational. She is dedicated to helping students discover their passion for debate.

coaches.name: Catherine Wong
coaches.title: Debate & Public Speaking Coach
coaches.bio: A University of Toronto student ranked as one of Canada's best debaters, Catherine has earned multiple Top Speaker awards at provincial and national tournaments. She has coached at DSDC for over two years, sharing the confidence and persuasion skills debate has given her.

coaches.name: Anisha Biswas
coaches.title: Debate Coach
coaches.bio: A UBC Neuroscience student with over five years of coaching experience, Anisha has competed at regional, provincial, and national tournaments. She co-founded a debate club at a local elementary school to spread the benefits of public speaking to younger students.

coaches.name: Akash Krishnamurthy
coaches.title: Debate Coach
coaches.bio: One of BC's top debaters with multiple Champion and Top Speaker titles, Akash started as a DSDC student and now coaches the next generation. His passion for debate was sparked at DSDC, and he is committed to sharing that same enthusiasm with his students.

classesPage.unsure: Not sure which class is right for your child?

classes.name: Novice
classes.description: An excellent starting point for younger scholars eager to develop public speaking and debate skills. Our coaches help students build confidence through the fundamentals of speech execution and foundational debate formats — even shy and introverted children thrive in this nurturing environment.

classes.name: Junior
classes.description: Build competitive debate skills while accelerating academic growth. Coaches integrate challenging topics like International Relations, Law, Philosophy, and Economics into debate classes, with unique opportunities to compete in tournaments, volunteer, and expand knowledge.

classes.name: Senior
classes.description: Rigorous practice in British Parliamentary, CNDF, and World Schools formats, with advanced lectures on complex topics. This class pushes students to question what they already know and cultivates the competitive edge needed to excel at tournaments.

classes.name: Advanced Competitive
classes.description: An elite program led by world-renowned university debaters for students deeply committed to competitive debate. Through intensive drills, mock debates, and personalized coaching, students develop the advanced techniques needed to win at national and international tournaments.

classes.name: World Scholar's Cup
classes.description: Full preparation for WSC from regionals to the Tournament of Champions at Yale University. Students may travel to Beijing, Amsterdam, Sydney, and beyond. We're proud to have achieved a 100% qualification rate spanning regional, global, and ToC levels over the past five years.

classes.name: Public Speaking
classes.description: Comprehensive training in impromptu, persuasive, interpretive, and parliamentary debate formats. Designed to prepare students for BC speech provincials with the confidence, technique, and adaptability needed to excel on stage.
